title: Here are projected rain totals for Carolinas amid Tropical Storm Debby
message:
The National Hurricane Center on Thursday, Aug. 8 released updated projections of rain totals and Tropical Storm Debby’s trajectory for the next few days.
Rain totals near 30 inches were initially possible in South Carolina near Charleston, according to the National Hurricane Center.
Parts of North, South Carolina to see most rainSoutheast North Carolina and northeast South Carolina were projected to see the most rain on Thursday and Friday -- though central Virginia could also see significant rainfall.
(National Hurricane Center)The western parts of the Carolinas should see much less rain this week.
The coast along the Carolinas could see 1-3 feet of storm surge amid Tropical Storm Debby, the National Hurricane Center posted on Aug. 7, 2024.

title: Tropical Storm Debby : Latest forecast track as it makes second landfall in South Carolina , drenching East Coast
message:

A South Carolina resident cleans up around his house after Tropical Storm Debby hit the area.

title: Debby leaves flooding and property damage in Southeast as more winds expected
message:

title: Powerful 7 . 1 - Magnitude Earthquake Hits Southern Japan , Tsunami Advisory Issued
message:
Japan Earthquake: A powerful earthquake struck off Japan's southern coast on Thursday, triggering a tsunami advisory.
The Japan Meteorological Agency said the quake registered magnitude 7.1 and was centred off the eastern coast of Japan's southern main island of Kyushu at a depth of about 30 km (18.6 miles).
It issued a tsunami advisory, predicting waves of up to 1 metre (3.3 feet) along the southern coast of Kyushu and nearby island of Shikoku.
Japan sits on the Pacific 'Ring of Fire', the line of seismic faults encircling the Pacific Ocean, and is one of the world's most earthquake-prone countries.
An earthquake on Jan 1 in Japan's north-central region of Noto left more than 240 people dead.

title: Malaysians in areas affected by southern California earthquake urged to remain vigilant
message:
PUTRAJAYA: Malaysians in areas affected by the earthquake in southern California are urged to remain vigilant and adhere to safety guidelines issued by local authorities, said the Foreign Ministry.
According to a statement, the Foreign Ministry, through the Consulate General of Malaysia in Los Angeles, is actively monitoring the situation following a 5.2-magnitude earthquake that occurred near Bakersfield, Southern California.
"The Foreign Ministry will continue to closely monitor the developments and provide updates as necessary to ensure the safety and well-being of all Malaysians in the affected regions,” the statement read.
According to the Foreign Ministry, Malaysians requiring consular assistance can contact the Consulate General of Malaysia in Los Angeles at 777 South Figueroa Street, Suite 600, Los Angeles, California or telephone +1-213-892 1238 or email mwlosangeles@kln.gov.my.
"As we continue to handle the ongoing Atlantic hurricane season, including monitoring Tropical Storm Debby in Florida, we are extending our vigilance to the earthquake effects in California,” the statement added.

title: Clarkton residents worry about canal flooding as Tropical Storm Debby moves through
message:
Clarkton residents worry about canal flooding as Tropical Storm Debby moves throughCLARKTON, NC (WWAY) — In Bladen County, there are growing concerns about inland flooding from Tropical Storm Debby.
In the town of Clarkton, some residents are worried the canals won’t be able to move all the rainwater away from their homes.
Some areas of Clarkton flooded earlier this week after a storm, which caused a tree to fall into one of the canals.
Clarkton resident Rhonda Caballero said she feels the town didn’t do enough after Hurricane Florence to prevent flooding of the canals again.

title: A powerful earthquake hits off southern Japan ; tsunami advisory issued
message:
TOKYO (AP) — A powerful earthquake struck off Japan’s southern coast on Thursday, triggering a tsunami advisory.
Residents were urged to stay away from the coastline, but there were no immediate reports of injuries or serious damage.
The Japan Meteorological Agency said the quake registered magnitude 7.1 and was centered in waters off the eastern coast of Japan’s southern main island of Kyushu at a depth of about 30 kilometers (18.6 miles).
The agency said tsunami waves of up 50 centimeters (1.6 feet) were detected along parts of Kyushu’s southern coast and the nearby island of Shikoku about a half hour after the quake struck.

title: Tropical Storm Debby makes second U . S . landfall , in South Carolina
message:
Tropical Storm Debby, which has already dumped more than a foot of rain on parts of the South and is forecast to bring more, made a second landfall in the U.S. early Thursday when it crossed back into South Carolina.
The storm, which had 50 mph winds, made landfall near Bulls Bay, South Carolina, the National Hurricane Center said in a 2 a.m.
Debby brought tornado warnings to parts of North Carolina early Thursday.
There's a high risk for flash flooding for Wilmington, North Carolina, up to Roanoke, Virginia.

message:
Tropical Storm Debby makes 2nd landfall in South Carolina, heavy rain expected up the East CoastHUGER, S.C. (AP) — Tropical Storm Debby spawned damaging tornadoes, flooded a town and temporarily shut down part of Interstate 95 early Thursday as it blew into North Carolina after making a second landfall overnight.
The National Hurricane Center says Debby came ashore early Thursday near Bulls Bay, South Carolina.
It was still a tropical storm Thursday morning, with maximum sustained winds at 50 mph (80 kph).
Debby also could bring more tornadoes Thursday in parts of North Carolina and Virginia, forecasters said.
Moisture from the tropical storm strengthened another system Tuesday evening, which caused strong thunderstorms, according to weather service meteorologist Scott Kleebauer.

title: A powerful earthquake measuring magnitude 6 . 9 hits off southern Japan ; tsunami advisory issued
message: By The Associated PressAugust 8, 2024, 3:58 AM

title: Tropical Storm Debby makes 2nd landfall in South Carolina , heavy rain expected up the East Coast
message:
Tornado death raises Tropical Storm Debby toll to 7 as heavy rains keep fallingLUCAMA, N.C. (AP) — Tropical Storm Debby spawned damaging tornadoes that killed one person, flooded a town and temporarily shut down part of Interstate 95 early Thursday as it blew into North Carolina after making a second landfall overnight.
The National Hurricane Center says Debby came ashore early Thursday near Bulls Bay, South Carolina.
It was still a tropical storm Thursday morning, with maximum sustained winds at 50 mph (80 kph).
Debby also could bring more tornadoes Thursday in parts of North Carolina and Virginia, forecasters said.
Moisture from the tropical storm strengthened another system Tuesday evening, which caused strong thunderstorms, according to weather service meteorologist Scott Kleebauer.

title: Tropical Storm Debby makes 2nd landfall in South Carolina , heavy rain expected up the East Coast
message:
Keon Johnson and his wife, Zyla Johnson, left, talk about how to get to work since his house on Tappan Zee Drive was flooded on Monday from Tropical Storm Debby in Pooler, Georgia.
APHUGER, S.C. — Tropical Storm Debby has made a second landfall in South Carolina on its way up the East Coast, where residents as far north as Vermont could get several inches of rain this weekend.
The National Hurricane Center says Debby came ashore early Thursday near Bulls Bay, South Carolina.
It is now a tropical storm with maximum sustained winds at 50 mph (80 kph).
Moisture from the tropical storm strengthened another system Tuesday evening, which caused strong thunderstorms, according to weather service meteorologist Scott Kleebauer.

title: Tsunami advisory issued after 7 . 1 magnitude quake shakes southern Japan
message:
A powerful earthquake struck off Japan's southern coast on Thursday, triggering a tsunami advisory that urged residents to stay away from the coastline.
The Japan Meteorological Agency said the quake registered magnitude 7.1 and was centered in waters off the eastern coast of Japan's southern main island of Kyushu at a depth of about 30 kilometers (18.6 miles).
The quake most strongly shook Nichinan city and nearby areas in Miyazaki prefecture on Kyushu island.
They later issued an assessment that the potential for a future quake in the area from Kyushu to central Japan is higher than previously predicted.
He urged residents of the affected region to stay away from the coastline.

title: Powerful 7 . 1 magnitude earthquake hits off southern Japan ; tsunami advisory issued
message:
TOKYO (AP) — A powerful earthquake struck off Japan’s southern coast on Thursday, triggering a tsunami advisory.
The Japan Meteorological Agency said the quake registered magnitude 7.1 and was centered in waters off the eastern coast of Japan’s southern main island of Kyushu at a depth of about 30 kilometers (18.6 miles).
The quake most strongly shook Nichinan city and nearby areas in Miyazaki prefecture on Kyushu island.

title: Restaurants in Beaufort prepare for Tropical Storm Debby
message:
BEAUFORT, N.C. (WITN) - Tropical Storm Debby is inching closer to eastern Carolina, and restaurants across the area are preparing for the impact.
Around Beaufort, tables and chairs were seen stacked as the town braces for Debby.
Ciara Heuser recently moved to the area and says the restaurant she works at will take the storm day by day.
“We are one of the higher restaurants,” said Front Street Grill at Saltwater general manager Shannon Piner.
Tropical storms are something Piner says she is used to, which is why safety is top priority.

title: Debby returns to SC and the slow - moving tropical storm continues to drench the Midlands
message:
Debby returns to SC and the slow-moving tropical storm continues to drench the MidlandsAfter a lull where Debby was over the Atlantic Ocean, the tropical storm returned to South Carolina on Thursday, and is continuing to soak the Columbia area as it slowly moves through the Palmetto State.
The forecast for Tropical Storm Debby tracks through South Carolina.
Localized amounts in other parts of the area could be higher, the National Weather Service said.
The forecast for Tropical Storm Debby tracks through South Carolina.
The forecast for Tropical Storm Debby tracks through South Carolina.

title: Strong earthquake with preliminary magnitude of 7 . 1 strikes coast of Japan
message:
LONDON -- A strong earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 7.1 has rocked the coast of southern Japan, according to the U.S. Geological Survey.
The epicenter of the earthquake is just a dozen miles off the coast of the city of Miyazaki on the island of Kyushu in Japan but the Japan Meteorological Agency has now lifted tsunami advisories for all but Miyazaki Prefecture.
People take shelter outside building following an earthquake in Miyazaki, western Japan, Thursday, Aug. 8, 2024.
The Japan Meteorological Agency initially issued a tsunami advisory, predicting waves of up to 1 meter (3.3 feet) along the southern coast of Kyushu and nearby island of Shikoku.
Police officers stand guard near a building damaged following an earthquake in Miyazaki, southwestern Japan, August 8, 2024, in this photo taken by Kyodo.

title: 7 . 1 magnitude earthquake strikes coast of Japan , tsunami advisories triggered
message:
7.1 magnitude earthquake strikes coast of Japan, tsunami advisories triggeredLONDON -- A strong earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 7.1 has rocked the coast of southern Japan as tsunami advisories have been triggered in the region, according to the U.S. Geological Survey.
The epicenter of the earthquake is just a dozen miles off the coast of the city of Miyazaki on the island of Kyushu in Japan.
Miyazaki, with a population of approximately 400,000 people, is now on alert for potential tsunamis in the aftermath of the quake.
The Japan Meteorological Agency issued a tsunami advisory, predicting waves of up to 1 meter (3.3 feet) along the southern coast of Kyushu and nearby island of Shikoku.
People have been urged to stay away from the coast or river and have been warned that other quakes -- even on the same magnitude --may occur.

title: 2024 Atlantic Hurricane Season : CSU updates forecast , still calls for  active season
message:
Colorado State University (CSU) just updated their prediction for the 2024 hurricane season.
The revised forecast, released on Tuesday, Aug. 6, still calls for an extremely active Atlantic hurricane season, which lasts from June 1 to November 30..
Why are they predicting an active hurricane season in 2024?
Why did CSU change their Atlantic Hurricane Season forecast?
This article originally appeared on The Patriot Ledger: 2024 Hurricane Season: CSU updates forecast.

title: Japan earthquake : Magnitude 7 . 1 quake hits southern part of island nation , tsunami warning issued
message:
Japan earthquake: Magnitude 7.1 quake hits southern part of island nation, tsunami warning issuedThe quake was centred off the eastern coast of Japan's southern main island of Kyushu at a depth of about 30 kilometreA powerful earthquake struck off Japan's southern coast on Thursday, triggering a tsunami advisory.
The Japan Meteorological Agency said the quake registered magnitude 7.1 and was centred in waters off the eastern coast of Japan's southern main island of Kyushu at a depth of about 30 kilometres (18.6 miles).
The quake most strongly shook Nichinan city and nearby areas in Miyazaki prefecture on Kyushu island.
The agency said tsunami waves of up 50 centimetres (1.6 feet) were detected along parts of Kyushu's southern coast and the nearby island of Shikoku about a half hour after the quake struck.
Earthquakes in areas with nuclear power plants have been a major concern since a massive earthquake and tsunami in March 2011 triggered the Fukushima nuclear disaster.

title: A powerful earthquake hits off southern Japan ; tsunami advisory issued
message:
TOKYO (AP) — A powerful earthquake struck off Japan’s southern coast on Thursday, triggering a tsunami advisory.
Residents were urged to stay away from the coastline, but there were no immediate reports of injuries or serious damage.
The Japan Meteorological Agency said the quake registered magnitude 7.1 and was centered in waters off the eastern coast of Japan’s southern main island of Kyushu at a depth of about 30 kilometers (18.6 miles).
The agency said tsunami waves of up 50 centimeters (1.6 feet) were detected along parts of Kyushu’s southern coast and the nearby island of Shikoku about a half hour after the quake struck.
Earthquakes in areas with nuclear power plants have been a major concern since a massive earthquake and tsunami in March 2011 triggered the Fukushima nuclear disaster.

title: Magnitude 7 . 1 earthquake hits Japan southern region , tsunami warnings issued
message:

These warnings are also extended to the Kagoshima and Ehime prefectures, with the Miyazaki prefecture the one impacted the most.

message:

title: Water district  takes dam safety very seriously  even in wake of  small earthquake  – St George News
message:
Jessop and others quickly checked the dams at the Kolob, Sand Hollow, Quail Creek, Ivins and Gunlock reservoirs for any potential problems.
The water district also works closely with engineers and the state’s own dam safety program, he said.
Over 800 dams in Utah are monitored and inspected by the Division of Water Rights’ Dam Safety Section while the 50 federal dams in the state are overseen by the Bureau of Reclamation.
Both the state and federal agencies have standards for dam construction that include taking seismic, or earthquake, potential into account.
Zach Renstorm, the general manager of the county water district, praised the swift response of Jessop and others who made sure the dams weren’t affected by the earthquake.

title: Tropical rains flood homes in an inland Georgia neighborhood for the second time since 2016
message:
In October 2016, heavy rain from Hurricane Matthew overwhelmed a nearby canal and flooded several of the same homes.
Some low-lying neighborhoods flooded, including the homes on Tappan Zee Drive.
He didn't live on the street when Matthew struck in 2016, but said the street had flooded during a heavy rainstorm in 2020.
Before Debby arrived, soaking rains last filled the street in February, but not enough to damage any homes, said Jim Bartley, who also lives on Tappan Zee Drives.
But he also doesn't want to sell, like many of the street's homeowners who saw flood damage from the 2016 hurricane.

title: Charlotte gears up for storm : Hardware stores see surge , county Monitors water levels
message:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (WBTV) - Charlotte residents are preparing for the approaching storm as local groups work to ensure they’re ready to respond.
Tim Trautman, the Mecklenburg County Stormwater Program Manager, highlighted a network of sensors and cameras monitoring water levels in real-time.
These systems become crucial during heavy rainfall events, alerting authorities to areas at risk of overflowing creeks and subsequent road closures.
Trautman warned that last week’s storms brought water levels halfway up the banks of some creeks, raising concerns about potential flooding with the expected rainfall.
“They communicate messages to our staff as well as our emergency managers, so that they can decide where to deploy resources.”Local hardware stores are experiencing a surge in storm preparation supplies.

title: Tropical rains flood homes in an inland Georgia neighborhood for the second time since 2016
message:

Some low-lying neighborhoods flooded, including the homes on Tappan Zee Drive.
He didn't live on the street when Matthew struck in 2016, but said the street had flooded during a heavy rainstorm in 2020.
Before Debby arrived, soaking rains last filled the street in February, but not enough to damage any homes, said Jim Bartley, who also lives on Tappan Zee Drives.
But he also doesn't want to sell, like many of the street's homeowners who saw flood damage from the 2016 hurricane.
